definitions.def: The potential difference created by relative motion of a conductor and a magnetic field.

secText: The creation of a potential difference (and current) by the motion of a conductor through a magnetic field is the source of most electricity.

Although there is no battery in the circuit we show, the light bulb glows when the wire moves. The motion of the wire perpendicular to the magnetic field induces an emf that causes a current. The current makes the light bulb glow. As long as the wire moves in the magnetic field, the light bulb will glow.
